content: If you right-click the account in the Folder Pane, Subscribe..., Refresh, can the missing folders be subscribed (checked)?
creator: sfhowes

content:
sfhowes said
If you right-click the account in the Folder Pane, Subscribe..., Refresh, can the missing folders be subscribed (checked)?

Nope, the refreshed list is the same as is shown in the left-side folder list. It's as if Thunderbird knows nothing about the invisible folders.
creator: JLT

content: One interesting thing: If I use Thunderbird to create a new folder, then a new folder inside that, those both are visible. If I then use Applemail to move a folder that is Thunderbird-invisible to be inside that first created folder, Applemail then happily shows the two folders (the newly created subfolder and the problem folder) inside that new parent folder. But viewing even after refreshing/restarting in Thunderbird still only shows the one new empty subfolder inside that new parent folder. There's something about the old folder that Thunderbird just doesn't like.
creator: JLT

content: This is a Thunderbird & not Windows issue. Have you deleted all the previous passwords stored & given Thunderbird the permission to remember the password ? It could also be due to JavaScript being turned off in Thunderbird.
creator: singhal_rajiv

content:
singhal_rajiv said
This is a Thunderbird & not Windows issue. Have you deleted all the previous passwords stored & given Thunderbird the permission to remember the password ? It could also be due to JavaScript being turned off in Thunderbird.

can you be more specific? give specific instructions like "click on file > settings > ..etc" i have no idea which settings and where i have to change. this is so generic thing that i already know what you said. giving vague and far fetched replies isn't gonna help.

and yes i deleted the old app passwords that were saved, it still keeps asking me to login every time i open thunderbird, this is really annoying.
creator: mordax

content: Something to check is that under Settings > Privacy & Security "Allow cookies from sites" is ticked.
creator: ThePillenwerfer

content:
Ciao, il problema dovrebbe essere questo -> https://codeberg.org/m13o/TBook/wiki/Thunderbird+-+Mittente+sbagliato+nelle+PEC.-

In pratica hai associato l'indirizzo di un gestore PEC al nome di un tuo corrispondente. Per cui tutte le mail da quel gestore appaiono arrivare da quel mittente. Dovrebbe essere sufficiente eliminare quel contatto dalla rubrica.
creator: @next

content: Molto probabilmente Thunderbird viene bloccato dal tuo Antivirus dopo l'ultimo aggiornamento. È stato segnalato anche altre volte. Purtroppo non conoscendo quale antivirus hai non posso essere più preciso. Ma per risolvere di solito si deve disattivare la funzione che intercetta la posta in uscita. O attendere che il produttore dell'antivirus si accorga dell'errore e lo corregga.
creator: @next

content: Uso kaspersky, ma avevo provato a disabilitarlo un attimo e mi dava comunque problemi. Da dove si va per la questione che dicevi?

content: Mi spiace ma non ne ho idea, non uso Kaspersky. Prova a leggere qui https://forum.kaspersky.com/topic/pr_connect_reset_error-on-firefox-35402/ Si riferisce a Firefox ma l'errore è dello stesso tipo.

content:
Eh avevo dato un'occhiata, ma nulla da fare. Ho anche provato a disabilitare kaspersky o disabilitare le varie funzioni, firewall, posta ecc ecc ma niente. Poi tutt'un tratto da ieri pomeriggio.

Sono convinto che se disinstallo kaspersky fa la stessa cosa.
